meanings.definition: A person who engages in sabotage.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky saboteur damaged the factory equipment.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the saboteur red-handed at the scene of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous saboteur played pranks on his coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The saboteur of our plans was unexpected and caused chaos.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the saboteur lurking in the shadows, ready to cause trouble.

meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy, damage, or obstruct something, especially for political or military purposes.
meanings.sent1: The spy tried to saboteur the enemy's communication lines.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to saboteur government property.
meanings.sent3: He decided to saboteur the rival team's chances by hiding their equipment.
meanings.sent4: The storm threatened to saboteur our outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: She used her words to saboteur his reputation, spreading lies about him.
